pros: Great staff for the most part within the hospital.  It's great to be working in the North for a hospital that is fairly progressive.
cons: Policied to death.  A sign of poor managment.  Staff are treated like second rate citizens.  eg:  our uniforms are the falling apart as soon as they are issued.  Managment states they were the lowest bidder so thats what we get.  We were had to work last winter without a winter coat in - 30 C weather.  Managment tends to try & create poor staff comraderie by expecting us to play Big Brother  to each other.  A great deal of back stabbing amoung staff in this dept.  Some positive feedback from Management would be nice.

review_title: Hours arent great, but the staff certainly are!
cons: No chance for advancing. Seniority does not matter over being Francophone. All Full-time jobs go to those who can speak french. CUPE says they cant do anything about it. All the part-timers have the most seniority, Full-timers in these positions are new, or just bounce from Full Time to Full Time position internally because they can pick and choose, and are more special than those of us who are not Francophone. NBRHC even flies a Francophone flag to rub it in our face. Loved my job, but as a part-timer 3-4 shifts a pay (every two weeks)  doesnt cut it :(

pros: Great place to work. I enjoy it here
cons: I don't have much to complain about
